hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1
hadith_list.english_text:
the Prophet said: "Salat will not be accepted without purification, nor Charity from Ghulul."

Hannad said in his narration, "except with purification"

[Abu `Eisa said: This Hadith is the most correct thing on this topic, and the best. There are also narrations on this topic from Abu Al-Malih, from his father; and Abu Hurairah and Anas. And Abu Al-Malih bin Usamah's name is `Amir, and they also say it was Zaid bin Usamah bin `Umair Al-Hudhali.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 2
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "When a Muslim, or believer, performs Wudu', washing his face, every evil that he looked at with his eyes leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water, or an expression similar to that - and when he washes his hands, every evil he did with his hands leaves with the water - or with the last drop of water - until he becomes free of sin."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 3
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet, said: "The key to Salat is the purification, its Tahrlm is the Takblr, and its Tahlil is the Taslim."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 4
hadith_list.narrator: Jabir bin 'Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, narrated that :
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "The key to Paradise is Salat, and the key to Salat is Wudu'."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 5
hadith_list.english_text: "When the Prophet entered the toilet he would say: 'O Allah Indeed I seek refuge in You.'" Shu'bah (one of the narrators) said: "Another time he said: 'I seek refuge in You from AI-Khubthi and al-Khablth.' Or: 'Al-Khubthi and Al-Khaba'ith.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 6
hadith_list.english_text: "When the Prophet would enter the toilet 'He said: "O Allah! Indeed I seek refuge in You from Al-Khubith and Al- Khaba'ith."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 7
hadith_list.narrator: 'Aishah, [may Allah be pleased with her] said:
hadith_list.english_text: "When the Prophet would exit the toilet he would say: 'Ghufranak.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 8
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you arrives to defecate, then let none of you face the Qiblah while defecating, nor while urinating. And do not have your back towards it, but have it east of you or west of you."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 9
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet prohibited us from facing the Qiblah while urinating. Then i saw him facing it a year before he died."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 10
hadith_list.english_text: he saw the Prophet urinating while facing the Qiblah. Qutaibah narrated that to us, he said: "Ibn Lahi'ah informed us." Jabir's Hadlth about the Prophet is more correct than the Hadith of Ibn Lahi'ah. Ibn Lahi'ah is weak according to the scholars of Hadith. He was graded weak by Yahya bin Sa'eed Al-Qattan, and others, [due to his memorization].

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 11
hadith_list.english_text: "One day I climbed on Hafsah's house, and I saw the Prophet relieving himself while facing Ash-Sham, with his back toward the Ka'bah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 12
hadith_list.english_text: "Whoever narrated to you that the Prophet would urinate while standing; then do not believe him. He would not urinate except while squatting." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Buraidah, [and Abdur-Rahman bin Hasanah].

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 13
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger came to a waste area used by people, so he urinated on it while standing. I brought him the (water for) Wudu. Then I left to be away from him, but he called me until I was behind him. So he performed Wudu and wiped (Masaba) over his Khuff."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 14
hadith_list.narrator: Anas, may Allah Most High be pleased with him, said:
hadith_list.english_text: "When the Prophet  wanted to relieve  himself, he would not raise his garment until he was close to the ground."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 15
hadith_list.narrator: Abdullah bin Abu Qatadah narrated from his father:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet prohibited that a man  should touch his penis with his right hand."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 16
hadith_list.english_text: "They said to Salman, 'Your Prophet taught you about everything, even defecating?' So Salman said, 'Yes. He prohibited us from facing the Qiblah when defecating and urinating, performing Istinja with the right hand, using less than three stones for Istinja, and using dung or bones for Istinja"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 17
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger went out to relieve himself. So he said: 'Bring me tree stones.'" He said, "So I came with two stones and a piece of dung. So he took the two stones, and left the dung. He said: 'It is Riks (a degenerative or filthy thing)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 18
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "Do not perform Istinja, with dung, nor with bones. For indeed it is provisions for your brothers among the Jinn."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 19
hadith_list.english_text: "Encourage your Husbands to clean themselves with water, for I am too shy of them, and Allah's Messenger would do that."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 20
hadith_list.english_text: I was with the Prophet on a journey. The Prophet had to relieve himself, so he went far away."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 21
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet  prohibited that a man should urinate in his bathing area. And he said: "It will only cause misgivings." [He said:] There are narrations on This topic from "a man from among the Companions of the Prophet."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 22
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation, then I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 23
hadith_list.english_text: 'I heard Allah's Messenger saying: 'If it were not that it would be difficult on my nation then, I would have ordered them to use the Siwak for each prayer and to delay the Isha prayer until the third of the night.'"He [Abu Salamah, one of the narrators] said: Zaid bin Khalid wouId attend the prayer in the Masjid and his Siwak would be on his ear in the location of the pen on the ear of a writer. He would not get up to pray without cleaning his teeth, then returning it to its location."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 24
hadith_list.english_text: Prophet said: "When on of you awakens in the night, then let him not put his hand into the vessel until he has poured water on two times, or three times, for indeed he does not know where his hand has spent the night."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 25
hadith_list.narrator: Rabah bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated from his grandmother, from her father; she said (that he said):
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard Allah's Messenger saying: there is no Wudu for one who does not mention Allah's Name over it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 26
hadith_list.narrator: Rabah Bin Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Sufyan bin Huwaitib narrated :
hadith_list.english_text: the same from his grandmother the daughter of Sa'eed bin Zaid, from her father, from the Prophet.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 27
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "When you perform Wudu then sniff water in the nose and blow it out, and when you use small stones (to remove filth) then make it odd (numbered)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 28
hadith_list.english_text: "1 saw the Prophet rinse his mouth and sniff water in his nose using one hand, he did that thrice,"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 29
hadith_list.english_text: "1 saw Ammar bin Yasir performing Wudu, so he went through his beard (with his hand). It was said to him" - or he said - "1 said: 'You go through your beard?' He said: 'And what is there to prevent me? Indeed I saw Allah's Messenger going through his beard.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 30
hadith_list.english_text: the same from the Prophet.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 31
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet would go through his beard."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 32
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger wiped over his head with his hands, going over the front with them and the rear. He began with the front of his head until they went to the nape of his neck. Then he brought them back again to the place where he began. Then he washed his feet."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 33
hadith_list.narrator: Ar-Rubay' bint Mu'awwidh bin Afra' narrated:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet wiped his head two times: He began with the rear of his head, then with the front of his head and with both of his ears, outside and Inside of them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 34
hadith_list.narrator: Ar-Rubayy bint Mu'awidh bin Afra narrated that :
hadith_list.english_text: she saw the Prophet performing Wudu. She  said: "He wiped his head, and  what is in the front of it and what is in its rear, and his temples and his ears one time."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 35
hadith_list.english_text: he saw the Prophet performing Wudu, and that he wiped his head with water that was not left over from his hands.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 36
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet wiped his head and his ears: the outside and the inside of them." ($ahih)

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 37
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu; so he washed his face three times, and his hands three times, and wiped his head, and he said: "The ears are part of the head."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 38
hadith_list.narrator: Asim bin Laqit bin Sabirah narrated from his father that :
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet Muhammad said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 39
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "When performing Wudu go between the fingers of your hands and (toes of) your feet."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 40
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Prophet when he was performing Wudu doing that to the toes on his feet with his pinky."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 41
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Protect the heels from the Fire!"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 42
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time (for each limb)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 43
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu two time (for each limb)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 44
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu three times (for each limb)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 45
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each, and two times, and three times?" He said: "Yes."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 46
hadith_list.english_text: "1 asked Abu Ja'far: 'Did Jabir narrate to you that: "The Prophet performed Wudu one time each?" He said: "Yes."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 47
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu. So he washed his face three times, and washed his hands two times each, and wiped his head, and washed his feet [two times]."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 48
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw Ali performing Wudu. He washed his hands until he cleaned them, then he rinsed out his mouth three times, sniffed water into his nose and blew it out three times, washed his face three times, and his forearms three times. He wiped his head once, then he washed his feet up to the ankles. Then he stood up, taking what was left over from his purification (water) and drank it while he was standing. Then he said, 'I wanted to show you how Allah's Messenger purified himself.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 49
hadith_list.narrator: Abd Khair related a narration similar to that of Abu Hayyah, :
hadith_list.english_text: from Ali (no. 48). Except that Abd Khair's version includes the following additions: "When he was finished from his purification, he would take what was left over from his purification with his hand to drink it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 50
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Jibril came to me and he said: 'O Muhammad! When you perform wudu then perform Nadh.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 51
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "Shall I tell you that for which Allah will wipe out your sins, and raise your ranks?" They said, "Of course Allah's Messenger!" He said:  "Performing Wudu well in difficulty, and taking many steps to the Masajid, and waiting for Salat after Salat, That is the Ribat."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 52
hadith_list.english_text: "For that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat, that is the Ribat" three times.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 53
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger had a cloth that he would use to dry off with after Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 54
hadith_list.english_text:
"I saw the Prophet when he performed Wudu, he wiped his face with the edge of his garment."  Abu Eisa said: This Hadith is gharib, and its chain is weak. Rishdin bin Sa'd and Abdur- Rahman bin Ziyad bin An'um Al Ifriqi [narrators in the chain of this Hadith] are weak in Hadith. Some people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet  and those after them, permitted using a towel after Wudu. 
Those who disliked it, only disliked it from the view of the saying: "Wudu is weighed." That as reported from Sa'eed bin Al- Musayyab and Az-Zuhri. Muhammad bin Humaid [Ar-Razi] narrated to us, Jarir narrated to us,  he said: Ali bin Mujahid narrated to me, and he is trustworthy to me, from me, from: Tha'labah from Az-Zuhri, he said: "The towel is only disliked after Wudu because Wudu is weighed."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 55
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: 'Whoever performs Wudu, making Wudu well, then says: (Ashhadu an la ilaha illallah, wahdahu la sharika lahu, wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan-abduhu wa rasuluhu, Allahummajalni minat tawwabin, waj'alni minal mutatahhirin) 'I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone, there are no partners for Him. And I testify that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. O Allah! Make me among the repentant, and make me among those who purify themselves.' Then eight gates of Paradise are opened for him, that may enter by whichever of them wishes."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 56
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu with a Mudd, and he would perform Ghusl with a Sa."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 57
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Indeed there is a Shaitan for Wudu' who is called "AI-Walahan." So beware of having misgivings about water."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 58
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would perform wudu for every Salat, whether he was in state of purity or not in a state of purity."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 59
hadith_list.narrator: It has been related in a narration from Ibn Umar that :
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Whoever performs Wudu while in a state of purity, Allah writes for him on account of it ten good merits."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 60
hadith_list.narrator: Amr bin Amir Al-Ansari narrated that he heard Anas bin Malik saying:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat." I said, "So what about you, what would you do?" He said I wouId pray all of the prayers with one Wudu, as long as we had not committed Hadath (anything that invalidates Wudu)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 61
hadith_list.narrator: Sulaiman bin Buraidah narrated that his father said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would perform Wudu for every Salat. So during the year of the Conquest, he performed all of the prayers with one Wudu, and he wiped over his Khuff. So Umar said, 'You did something that you have not done before?' He replied: "I did it on purpose."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 62
hadith_list.english_text: "I and Allah's Messenger would perform Ghusl for Janabah from one vessel."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 63
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Hajib narrated from a man from Banu Ghifar who said:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet prohibited using the leftover (water) of a woman's Purification."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 64
hadith_list.narrator: A1-Hakim bin Amr AI-Ghifari narrated that:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet forbade that a man should perform Wudu with the leftover (water) from a woman's purifcation." Or, he said: "from her drinking."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 65
hadith_list.english_text: "One of the wives of the Prophet performed Ghusl with a bowl. Allah's Messenger wanted to perform Wudu with it, so she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed I am ]unub.' So he said: 'Indeed, water does not become Junub.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 66
hadith_list.english_text: "It was said, 'O Allah's Messenger! Shall we use the water of Buda'ah well to perform ablution while it is a well in which menstruation rags, flesh of dogs and the putrid are dumped?" Allah's Messenger said: 'Indeed water is pure, nothing makes it impure.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 67
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard AlIah's Messenger while he was being asked about water in open areas of the land, and predators and beasts come to it." He said: 'So Allah's Messenger said: 'When the water is two Qullah it does not carry filth.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 68
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Let none of you urinate [in still water, then perform Wudu with it."1

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 69
hadith_list.english_text: "A man asked Allah's Messenger 'O Messenger of Allah! We sail the seas, and we only carry a little water with us. If we use it for Wudu then we will go thirsty. So shall we perform Wudu from the (water of the) sea?' Allah's Messenger said: 'Its water is pure, and its dead are lawful.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 70
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet passed by two graves. He said: 'These two are being punished. And they are not being punished for something major. As for this one, he would not protect himself from his urine. As for this one, he used to spread Namimah (slander).'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 71
hadith_list.english_text: "I entered upon the Prophet with a son of mine who was not yet eating food. He urinated on him, so he called for water which he sprinkled over it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 72
hadith_list.english_text: "Some people from Urainah arrived in Al-Madinah, and they were uncomfortable (and ill from the climate). So Allah's Messenger sent them some camels from charity. He told them: "Drink from their milk and urine." So they killed the camel driver that Allah's Messenger sent, and they violently drove off the camels, and apostatized from Islam. So the Prophet came to them, he cut off their hands and feet on opposite side, and branded their eyes, and threw them in Al-Harrah." Anas said, "So I saw one of them working over the ground with his mouth, until they died."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 73
hadith_list.english_text:
"Allah's Messenger only poked out their eyes because they had poked out the eyes of the camel driver." Abu 'Eisa said: This Hadfth is Gharib. We do not know anyone who mentioned it other than this shaikh, from Yazid bin Zurai. And it is in accordance with the meaning of Allah's saying: 
"And wounds equal for equal"
It has been reported that Muhammad bin Sirin said: "The Prophet only did this to them before the legislated punishments were revealed."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 74
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "There no Wudu except for a sound or a smell."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 75
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "When one of you is in the Masjid, and he senses wind between his buttocks then he should not exit until he hears a sound or smells an odor."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 76
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Indeed Allah does not accept the prayer of one of you when he commits Hadath, until he performs Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 77
hadith_list.english_text: he saw the Prophet sleeping, while in the prostration position, until he snored or snorted. Then he stoodup to pray. So I said: "O Messenger of Allah! You were sleeping?" He said: "Wudu is not required except for sleeping while reclining. For when one reclines, joints relax."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 78
hadith_list.english_text: "The companions of Allah's Messenger would sleep, then stand to pray, They would not perform Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 79
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger said: "Wudu is (required) from what fire has touched, even if it be a piece of cheese."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 80
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger went out and I went with him. He entered upon a woman from the Ansar. She slaughtered a sheep and he ate from it; and she brought a basket with ripe dates and he ate from it. Then he performed Wudu for Zuhr and prayed. Then he finished, so she brought him something from the remainder of the sheep. So he ate it, then prayed Asr and did not perform Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 81
hadith_list.english_text: Allah's Messenger was asked about performing Wudu for camel meat. He said: "Perform Wudu for it." He Was asked about Wudu after eating goat meat. So he said: "Do not perform Wudu for it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 82
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Whoever touches his penis, then he is not to pray until he performs Wudu"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 83
hadith_list.english_text: a similar report (as no. 82) from the Prophet.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 84
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said a similar Hadith

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 85
hadith_list.narrator: Qais bin Talq bin Ali - [and he is] Al-Hanafi narrated from his father, that:
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: 'Is it other than a piece of his flesh?" Or: "part of him?"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 86
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet kissed one of his wives, then he went to the prayer and did not perform Wudu."  He (Urwah) said: "I said 'Who was it except you?'" [He said:] "So she laughed."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 87
hadith_list.narrator: Madan bin Abi Talhah narrated from Abu Ad-Darda that :
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger vomited [so he broke fast] so he performed Wudu." So I met Thawban in a Masjid in Damascus, and I mentioned that to him. He said: 'He told the truth, I poured the water for his Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 88
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet asked me: "What is in your Idawah (water skin)?" I said: "Nabidh." He said: "Dates are wholesome and water is pure." He said: "So he performed Wudu with it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 89
hadith_list.english_text:
the Prophet drank milk. Then he called for water to rinse out his mouth. Then he said: "Indeed it has fat." [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi and Umm Salamah. 
Abu Eisa said: [And] this Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
Some of the people of knowledge held the view that one is to wash the mouth after drinking milk and this is recommended according us. Some others did not hold the view that one is to wash out the mouth after drinking milk.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 90
hadith_list.english_text: "A man greeted the Prophet (with Salam), and he was urinating, so he did not respond to him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 91
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Wash the vessel the dog has drunk from seven times: the first or the last of them with dirt. And when the cat drinks out of it, wash it once."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 92
hadith_list.narrator: Humaidah bint Ubaid bin Rifa'ah narrated:
hadith_list.english_text: "Kabshah bint Ka'b bin Malik - she was (married) with Ibn Abi Qatadah - narrated "That Abu Qatadah visited her, [so she said:] 'So I poured water for him to use for Wudu.' She said: 'A cat came to drink, so he lowered he container until it drank.' Kabshah said: 'So he saw me looking at it and said, "O my niece! Are you surprised at that?" So I said yes. He said: "Indeed Allah's  Messenger said 'It is not impure, it is only one of those roam around among you.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 93
hadith_list.english_text: "Jarir bin Abdullah urinated, then he performed Wudu, wiping over his Khuff. So he was asked, 'You do this?' He replied, 'What prevents me, when I have seen Allah's Messenger doing it?" He [Ibrahim] said "And they were impressed by the narration of Jarir since he accepted Islam after the revelation Sural Al-Ma'idah." [This is the saying of lbrahim, that is, "They were impressed."] [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from Umar, Ali, Hudhaifah, AI-Mughirah, Bilil, Sa'd, Abu Ayyub, Salman, Buraidah, Amr bin Umayyah, Anas, Sahl bin Sa'd, Ya'la bin Murrah, Ubadah bin As-Samit, Usamah bin Shank, Abu Umamah, Jabir, Usamah bin Zaid, and Ibn Ubadah. They call him Ibn Imarah and Ubayy bin Imarah.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 94
hadith_list.narrator: It has been related from Sahr bin Hawshah that he said:
hadith_list.english_text:
"I saw Jarir bin 'Abdullah performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff. I asked him about that. He replied, 'I saw 'I saw Allah's Messenger performing Wudu and he wiped over his Khuff.' So I said to him, before Surah AI-Ma'idah (was revealed) or after AI-Ma'idah?' So he replied, 'I did not acceot Islam until after Al-Ma'idah.'" Qutaibah narrated this to us; (saying) Khalid bin Ziyad At-Tirmidhi narrated it to us, from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir.
He said: Baqiyyah related it from Ibrahim bin Adham from Muqatil bin Hayyan, from Shahr bin Hawshah, from Jarir.
This Hadith is explanatory, because some who dislike wiping over the Khuff give the interpretation that the Prophet's wiping over the two Khuff was before the revelation of Sural Al-Ma'idah. But in his Hadlth, Jarir mentions that he saw the Prophet wiping over his Khuff after the revelation of Surat Al-Ma'idah.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 95
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet was asked about wiping over the Khuff.  So he said: "Three (days) for the traveler, and one day for the resident."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 96
hadith_list.english_text: 'When we were traveling, Allah's Messenger would order us not to remove our Khuff for three days and nights, except for Janabah, but not for defecating, urinating, and sleep."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 97
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and its bottom."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 98
hadith_list.english_text: "I saw the Prophet wiping over the Khuff: on the tops of them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 99
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu' and wiped over his socks and sandals."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 100
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah narrated from his father:
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet performed Wudu and wiped over the Khuff and 'Imamah." Abu Bakr (one of the narrators) said: "And indeed I heard it from Ibn Al Mughirah."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 101
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet wiped over the Khuff and the Khimar."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 102
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Ubaidah bin Muttammad bin Ammar bin Yasir said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked Jabir bin Abdullah about wiping over the Khuff. He said, 'O my nephew! It is the Sunnah.'" [He said:] "And I asked him about wiping over the lmamah. He said, '[Wipe1 the hair [with water].'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 103
hadith_list.narrator: Ibn 'Abbas narrated that his maternal aunt Maimunah said:
hadith_list.english_text: "I prepared some water for the Prophet to perform Ghusl for Janabah with. So he turned the vessel with his left hand, (pouring some water) over his right. Then he washed his hands. Then he entered his hand into the vessel to pour water over his private area, then he rubbed his hands on the wall, or the ground. Then he rinsed out his mouth and washed his nose by putting water in and blowing it out, and washed his face and forearms. Then he poured water over his head three times, then he poured water over the remainder of his body, then he moved from where he was and washed his feet."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 104
hadith_list.english_text: "When AlIah's Messenger wanted to perform Ghusl for Janabah, he would begin by washing his hands before putting them into the vessel. Then he would wash his private area, and perform the Wudu (as one does) for Salat. Then he would wet his hair with the water, then he would pour water over his head with his hands three times."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 105
hadith_list.english_text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am woman with tight braids on my head, should I undo it to perform Ghusl for Janabah? He said: 'No. It is sufficient that you only pour three scoops of water (with hands held together) over your head, then pour water over the rest of your body, to be purified.'" Or he said: "Then you will be purified."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 106
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Under every hair is sexual impurity so wash (all of) the hair and cleanse the skin."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 107
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet would not perform Wudu after the Ghusl."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 108
hadith_list.english_text: "When the circumcised meets the circumcised, then indeed Ghusl is required. Myself and Allah's Messenger did that, so we performed Ghusl."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 109
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "When the circumcised meets the circumcised then Ghusl is required."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 110
hadith_list.english_text: "Water is for water,' was only permitted in the beginning of Islam. Then it was prohibited."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 111
hadith_list.english_text: a similar narration (as Hadith no. 110) from, Az-Zuhri, with this chain.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 112
hadith_list.english_text: "Water is for water' is only about the wet dream."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 113
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet was asked about a man who finds wetness and he does not remember having a wet dream. So he said: 'He is to perform Ghusl. And (he was asked) about a man who had a wet dream but does not find any wetness, so he said: 'No Ghusl is required of him.' Umm Salamah said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Is the woman required to perform Ghusl if she sees that?' He replied: 'Yes. Indeed women are the partners of men.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 114
hadith_list.english_text: "I asked the Prophet about Al-Madhi. He said: "For Al-Madhi is Wudu, and for AI-Mani is Ghusl."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 115
hadith_list.english_text: "I suffered from a severe and troubling case of Al-Madhi. I was performing Ghusl often because of it. So I mentioned that to Allah's Messenger and asked him about it. He said: "You only need to perform Wudu for that." I said: "O Messenger of Allah! How about when it gets on my clothes?" He said: "It is sufficient for you to take a handful of water and sprinkle it n your garment wherever you see that it has touched it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 116
hadith_list.english_text: "Aishah had a guest to whom she lent a yellow wrap for him to sleep in. He had a wet dream, and was too embarrassed to send it to her while the traces of the wet dream were present on it. So he submerged it (washing it) in water, then he sent it to her. Aishah said, "Why did he ruin our garment? It would have been sufficient for him to scrape it off with his fingers. Sometimes I would scrape it off of the garment of Allah's Messenger with my fingers."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 117
hadith_list.narrator: Sulaiman bin Yasar narrated from Aishah, that :
hadith_list.english_text: she washed Mani from the garment of Allah's Messenger.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 118
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger would sleep while he was Junub, and without touching water (performing Ghusl)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 119
hadith_list.english_text: There is a similar report (as no. 1I8) narrated via Abu Ishaq.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 120
hadith_list.english_text: he asked the Prophet: "Can one of us sleep while he is Junub?" So he replied: "Yes, when he performs Wudu."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 121
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet met him while he was Junub. He said: "[So I slipped away from him - meaning:] I withdrew - to perform Ghusl. Then he returned, so he said: 'Where have you been?' Or: 'Where did you go?' I replied: 'I was Junub.' So he said: 'Indeed the believer is not defiled.'''

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 122
hadith_list.english_text: Umm Sulaim bint Milhan came to the Prophet and she said: 'O Messenger of Allah! Indeed Allah is not embarrassed of the truth. So is it required of a woman - meaning Ghusl - when she sees in her sleep similar to what a man sees?' He replied: 'Yes. When she finds water (wetness), then she is perform Ghusl.'" Umm Salamah said: "I said to her: 'O Umm SuIaim! You have disgraced the women!'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 123
hadith_list.english_text: "Sometimes the Prophet would perform Ghusl from Janabah then come to seek warmth from me, he would hold me and not perform Ghusl."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 124
hadith_list.english_text: AlIah's Messenger said: "Pure clean earth is a purifier for the Muslim; even if he did not find water for ten years. Then if he finds water, then let him use it (for purification) on his skin. For, that is better."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 125
hadith_list.english_text: "Fatimah bint Abi-Hubaish came to the Prophet and said: 'O Messenger of Allah! I am a woman who suffers from persistent bleeding and I do not become clean. Shall I give up Salat?' He said: 'No. That is only a bIood vessel, it is not menstruation. When your menstruation begins then leave the Salat. And when it ends, then wash the blood from you and perform Salat."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 126
hadith_list.narrator: Adiyy bin Thabit narrated from his father, that :
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said about the Mustahadah that she should: "Leave the Salat for the days of her period which she menstruates in, then perform Ghusl, and perform Wudu for every Salat, and observe Saum and perform Salat."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 127
hadith_list.english_text:
Abu Eisa said: Sharik is alone in narrating this Hadith from Abu Al Yaqzan.[He said:] I asked Muhammad (ibn Isma'il AI-Bukhari) about this Hadlth. I said: "Adiyy bin Thabit from his father, from his grandfather; what is the name of Adiyy's grandfather?" But Muhammad did not know his name. And I mentioned to Muhammad that Yahya bin Ma'in said his name is Dinar, and he did not contradict him.
Ahmad and 1shaq said ahout the Mustahadah: If she performs Ghusl for every prayer that is more prudent for her, and if she performs Wudu for each prayer, then that is acceptable from her, and if she combines between two prayers with (one) Ghusl then that is acceptable.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 128
hadith_list.english_text: "I had a case of blood flow that was severe and excessive. So I went to the Prophet to inform him and ask him about it. I found him in the house of my sister Zainab bint Jahsh. I said, 'O Messenger of Allah! I suffer from a case of severe and excessive blood flow. So what do you order me to do for it, and does this prevent me from fasting and performing Salat?' He said: 'Tie a cotton rag around yourself and the bIood will go away.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Make it tight.' I said, 'It is more than that.' He said: 'Then use a cloth (to bind it).' I said, it is more than that. It flows too much.' So the Prophet said: 'I will order you to do one of two things, which ever of them you do, it will be acceptable for you. You should know which of them you are able to do.' Then he said: 'This is only a blow from Shaitan. Menstruate for six or seven days, which Allah knows, then perform Ghusl. When you see that you have become pure and clean, then perform Salat for twenty-three or twenty-four nights and their days. Perform Salat and fast, and that will be acceptable for you. So do this (if you can) just as (other) women who menstruate and become pure during their periods of menstruation and purity. If (not, and) you are able to delay Zuhr and hasten Asr then perform Ghusl when you have become pure, and pray Zuhr and Asr together. Then delay Maghrib and hasten Isha, then perform Ghusl and combine the two prayers. So do this (if you are able). Then perform Ghusl with the dawn and pray. Do this, and fast if you are able to do so.' Then Allah's Messenger said: 'That is what is preferable to me of the two.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 129
hadith_list.english_text: "Umm Habibah hint Jahsh sought a verdict from Allah's Messenger. She said 'I suffer from persistent bleeding such that I do not become pere. Shall I give up the Salat?' He said: 'No, that is only a blood vessel. So perform Ghusl then pray.' So she would perform Ghusl for each prayer."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 130
hadith_list.english_text: a woman asked Aishah: "Shouldn't one of us make up her prayers the days of her menstruation?" So she said, "Are you one of the Haruriyyah? Indeed we would menstruate, and we were not ordered to make up."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 131
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "The menstruating woman does not recite - nor the Junub - anything from the Qur'an."  [He said:] There is narration on this topic from Ali

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 132
hadith_list.english_text: "When I would menstruate, Allah's Messenger ordered me to wear a waist wrap, then he would fondle me."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 133
hadith_list.english_text: I asked the Prophet about eating with a menstruating woman. He said: "Eat with her."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 134
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger said to me: 'Bring me the Khumrah from the Masjid.' She said: "I said: 'I am menstruating.' He said: 'Indeed your menstruation is not in your hand.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 135
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "Whoever engages in sexual intercourse with a menstruating woman, or a woman in her anus, consults a soothsayer, then he has disbelieved in what was revealed to Muhammad."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 136
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said about a man who had sexual intercourse with his wife while she is menstruating: "He should give half a Dinar in charity."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 137
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: "When the blood is red then (give) a Dinar. And when the blood is yellow then half Dinar."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 138
hadith_list.narrator: Asma' bint Abu Bakr narrated that :
hadith_list.english_text: a woman asked the Prophet about a garment that was touched by some menstrual blood. So Allah's Messenger said: "Remove it, and scrub it, then rinse it and pray in it"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 139
hadith_list.english_text: "The time of waiting for Nifas during the time of AIlah's Messenger was forty days. We used to cover our faces with reddish-brown Wars."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 140
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger would go around to his women with one Ghusl."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 141
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet said: When one of you comes to his wife, then he wants to repeat (it), let him perform Wudu between them."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 142
hadith_list.narrator: Hisham bin Urwah narrated from his father, (Urwah) from Abdullah bin AI-Arqam. :
hadith_list.english_text: He (Urwah) said: "While standing for the prayer he (Abdullah bin Al-Arqam) took a man by the hand leading him forward, he (Abdullah) was in front of the people, and he said: 'I heard Allah's Messenger say: "When standing for the prayer and one of you finds that he has to relieve himself then let him relieve himself first."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 143
hadith_list.narrator: Abdur-Rahman bin Awf's Umm Walad said, :
hadith_list.english_text: "I said to Umm Salamah: 'Indeed I am a woman with lengthy hems, and I walk in places of filth.' So she said: 'Allah's Messenger said: "It is purified by what comes after it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 144
hadith_list.english_text: the Prophet ordered him to perform Tayammum by rubbing his face and two palms.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 145
hadith_list.english_text: Ibn Abbas was asked ahout Tayammum. He said: "When Allah mentioned Wudu in His Book, He said: "So wash your faces and your hands (forearms) up to the elbows." And He said about Tayammum: "And rub therewith your faces and hands" And He said: "And the male thief and the female thief; cut off their hands." So the Sunnah for cutting is the two hands. So it is only the face and the hands, meaning, Tayammum."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 146
hadith_list.english_text: "Allah's Messenger would recite the Qur'an in all conditions, as long as he was not Junub."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 147
hadith_list.english_text: "A Bedouin entered the Masjid while the Prophet was sitting. He prayed, then when he was finished, he said: 'O Allah! Have mercy upon me and Muhammad, and do not have mercy on anyone along with us.' The Prophet turned, towards him and said: 'You have restricted something that is unrestricted.' It was not long before he was urinating in the Masjid. So the people rushed to him. But Prophet said: 'Pour a bucket of water over it - or - a tumbler of water over it.' Then he said: 'You have been sent to make things easy (for the people); you have not been sent to make things difficult for them.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 148
hadith_list.narrator: Anas bin Malik narrated similar to this (no. 147).:
hadith_list.english_text: [He said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Ibn Abbas, and Wathilah bin AI-Asqa.
